result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason W. Belisle

10:26 AM Defendant Jason W. Belisle appeared by video.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Jason W. Belisle.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. Defendant still in treatment.  Waived reading. Set for preliminary hearing. Waived time limits. Bond to continue.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:09 PM Defendant Jason W. Belisle appeared by video.  Attorney Alysja Otten appeared by video for Jason W. Belisle.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court for State of Wisconsin. Off record for Brief recess for a breakout room for DE to speak with counsel. Back on the record. Court calls case, cites appearances. Atty Otten makes statement, withdraw motion. DE is currently in treatment, request defendant be able to appear by zoom for initial appearances. Court authorizes zoom appearance. Bond to continue.
Motion hearing on September 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:06 PM Defendant Jason W. Belisle appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Stephanie Thomas-Schmidt appeared by video for Jason W. Belisle.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. Defendant currently in custody in Burnett County.  Atty Thomas-Schmidt makes statement re: non-appearance.  Defendant makes statement. State makes argument. Court sets $100 cash bond.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:35 AM Defendant Jason W. Belisle not in court.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Jason W. Belisle. Court calls case and appearances. No appearance by defendant. State requests warrant. Granted.

1:06 PM Defendant JASON W. BELISLE appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Alysja Otten appeared by video for JASON W. BELISLE. Court calls case and appearances. Court reviews file-no appearance by defendant on 7/11. Atty Otten makes statement-defendant currently in Burnett County Jail. Atty Otten requests the warrant not be issued and the initial appearance be reset. No objection from the State. Court questions the defendant. Defendant on a PO hold. Atty Otten makes statement. Court will not issue warrant-reset initial appearance. Bond to continue.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
